author: Shiv Sunny
text:
The family and friends of Rohith Vemula rebutted HRD Minister Smriti Irani’s claims point by point. “I had arrived at the suicide spot soon after Rohith’s death came to light. The police and doctors were very much in the room where the body was lying,” said Rohith’s brother Raja, who criticised Ms. Irani for making “false” claims about the death. The Minister had said in Parliament that no attempt was made to revive Rohith, no doctor was allowed near his body, and his body was instead used as a political tool. On Thursday, the duty doctor at the university contradicted the claim that no doctor was allowed near the body to revive Rohith.

Rohith’s friend Dontha Prasanth criticised Ms. Irani for concealing from the country the letter that had hinted at a possible suicide.

On December 18, Rohith had purportedly written to the Vice-Chancellor, expressing anguish at the “personal interest” shown by him [the V-C] in the “social boycott” of Dalit research scholars.

“In the letter, Rohith asked the V-C to provide all Dalit students with 10 milligrams of sodium azide and a rope at the time of admission. Why Ms. Irani did not mention this letter in Parliament,” Prasanth asked.
title: Police, doctors were in the room, say kin
